intro: Pachira manausensis, commonly known as the Manaus pachira, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Amazon Basin, particularly in regions of Brazil, Peru, and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its robust, woody stem and large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. It produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers followed by woody fruits containing several seeds. Pachira manausensis is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor environments.
